result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley Jon Carlson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report and serve on or before August 1st.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley Jon Carlson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Bradley Jon Carlson appeared with Attorney Martin Jarvis.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  Atty Jarvis offers a plea questionaire and waiver of rights form.  Atty Jarvis speaks re: agreement.  Court finds the def. freely and knowingly waives his rights. Defendant pleas no contest. Court finds there is a factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty.  State speaks re: sentencing, recomends 10 days county jail. Atty Jarvis speaks re: sentencing.  Defendant speaks to the court.  Court sentences the def. to 10 days county jail. Credit 1 day. Must report and serve on or before August 1st. + court costs of $443.00, DNA Surcharge and Sample. $187.90 Fine. 60 DTP or setup a payment plan.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Bradley Jon Carlson appeared with Attorney Martin Jarvis.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  Court speaks to the def. re: his plea questionaire and waiver of rights form.  Court finds the def. freely and knowingly waives his rights. Court finds there is a factual basis. Court speaks to the court.  Court recuses--Officer courts first cousin.

Defendant, Bradley Jon Carlson appeared with Attorney Martin Jarvis.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered.  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Not consume any alcohol. Not to enter an establishment that sells alcohol for consumption.

Defendant Bradley Jon Carlson in court, in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances.  Court speaks to the defendant.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Attorney Martin Jarvis in court.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances. Bench warrant issued. $500.00
